meanings.definition: Of or relating to a calf.
meanings.sent1: The vituline features of the young cow made it adorable.
meanings.sent2: The farmer noticed the vituline behavior of the calf as it frolicked in the field.
meanings.sent3: The vituline calf tried to imitate the older cows, but kept stumbling over its own hooves.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as vituline as the playful skipping of a calf in the meadow.
meanings.sent5: The vituline innocence in the calf's eyes melted the farmer's heart.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a calf.
meanings.sent1: The soft, vituline skin of the baby deer was a delight to touch.
meanings.sent2: The girl's laughter had a vituline quality that reminded him of a playful calf.
meanings.sent3: The vituline bounce in her step made her friends smile as they walked together.
meanings.sent4: His face lit up with a vituline joy when he saw the surprise birthday party.
meanings.sent5: The vituline charm of the young actor captivated the audience.
